div.bibl: Revyen, Oct. 3, 1903. [JOHN VALK TO PUBLISH POEMS](Editorial)

body.p: p.2........John Valk, the editor of Nordlyset, (Northern Light) who a few months ago celebrated his 60th birthday, is planning to publish a collection of his Danish and English poems, provided 500 buyers can be pledged beforehand. That should be easy! John Valk is such a characteristic and sympathetic representative of Danish-American Culture and such an excellent poet that his works ought to be enthusiastically received by a much greater number of people than the 500, necessary to cover the publishing expenses.

Besides Mr. Valk's own works in Danish and English, the issue will contain other beloved poems, translated from English to Danish and from Danish to English; in the latter group are poems by Drachmann, Bjornson, Stuckenberg and others, which have previously appeared in American Publications, and thus made these names known to Americans.
